content.description: Top rope climbing line on the right side of the wall. Use slab to start or traverse in from the left on the ledge above the slab.
content.location: Right side of the wall, 8th climbing line from the left and directly under the shared anchor. Shares with Tea Cups and Roller Coaster.
Middle of the wall, 7th climbing line from the left and 6th bolted line. Shares an anchor with Tilt-A-Whirl and Roller Coaster.

content.description: Tricky slab start or traverse in from the left on the ledge on top of the slab.
content.protection: 3 bolts to shared hook anchor. Drop your rope into the hooks and top rope/lower directly.
content.location: Right most bolted climbing line. Shares the anchor with Tea Cups and Tilt-A-Whirl.

content.description: Start near the chimney on the left side of the wall.
content.protection: 4 bolts to shared hooks anchor. Drop your rope into the hooks and lower off/top rope directly.

content.description: Another slabby start or traverse in from the left on the ledge above the slab.
content.protection: 4 bolts. Shares an anchor with Cotton Candy.
content.location: Middle of the wall, 6th climbing line and 5th bolted route from the left.

content.description: Slabby start or start on the left side slab ledge and traverse in to the start.
content.protection: 4 bolts to shared anchor with Demon Drop.

content.description: Top rope climbing line using the shared anchor for Log Flume.

content.location: Second route from the left, shares the anchor with Power Tower.
Third bolted route from the left.

content.description:
Beginner sport route crag which faces north. It is shaded in the afternoon, generally around 1:00 pm. This crag is cold in the winter but nice in the warmer months. The Amusement Park is directly below and faces the Panty Wall. 

  If you are a beginner, you will most likely have a fun day at the Amusement Park. If you are not a beginner, you might be slightly bored. 

  There are 4 hook anchors shared between the 9 climbing lines. Just drop your rope into the hooks and top rope/lower off dirctly from the hooks. Each of the first three anchors from left to right are shared with 2 routes each. The fourth (farthest right) anchor has 3 climbing lines shared. 

  All routes are initially graded 5.7, but some might be 5.6 or 5.8. Please fill in what you think the grades are for each. Thanks and have fun!
